author: moT01
message: fix(curriculum): rework daily challenge 75 to something more friendly (#62929)

files.patch:
@@ -1,23 +1,23 @@
 ---
 id: 68d2ba1468508398389487d0
-title: "Challenge 75: Missile Strike"
+title: "Challenge 75: Hidden Treasure"
 challengeType: 29
 dashedName: challenge-75
 ---
 
 # --description--
 
-Given a 2D array representing the location of your ship in the ocean, and an array with the coordinates (`[row, column]`) of a missile strike, return `"Hit"`, `"Miss"`, or `"Sunk"` using the following rules:
+Given a 2D array representing a map of the ocean floor that includes a hidden treasure, and an array with the coordinates (`[row, column]`) for the next dive of your treasure search, return `"Empty"`, `"Found"`, or `"Recovered"` using the following rules:
 
-- The given 2D array will contain exactly one unsunk ship.
+- The given 2D array will contain exactly one unrecovered treasure, which will occupy multiple cells.
 - Each cell in the 2D array will contain one of the following values:
-  - `"-"`: Water (no ship).
-  - `"O"`: A part of your ship that has not been struck.
-  - `"X"`: A part of your ship that has already been struck.
+  - `"-"`: No treasure.
+  - `"O"`: A part of the treasure that has not been found.
+  - `"X"`: A part of the treasure that has already been found.
 
-- If the strike hits the water, return `"Miss"`.
-- If the strike hits your ship, but at least one other part of the ship remains unstruck, return `"Hit"`.
-- If the strike hits the last unstruck part of your ship, return `"Sunk"`.
+- If the dive location has no treasure, return `"Empty"`.
+- If the dive location finds treasure, but at least one other part of the treasure remains unfound, return `"Found"`.
+- If the dive location finds the last unfound part of the treasure, return `"Recovered"`.
 
 For example, given:
 
@@ -29,61 +29,61 @@ For example, given:
 ]
 ```
 
-And `[2, 1]` for the coordinates of the missile strike, return `"Sunk"` because it hit the last unstruck part of your ship.
+And `[2, 1]` for the coordinates of the dive location, return `"Recovered"` because the dive found the last unfound part of the treasure.
 
 # --hints--
 
-`strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 1])` should return `"Sunk"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 1])` should return `"Recovered"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 1]), "Sunk")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 1]), "Recovered")`)
 }})
 ```
 
-`strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 0])` should return `"Miss"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 0])` should return `"Empty"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 0]), "Miss")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"]], [2, 0]), "Empty")`)
 }})
 ```
 
-`strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"], [ "-", "O"]], [1, 1])` should return `"Hit"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"], [ "-", "O"]], [1, 1])` should return `"Found"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"], [ "-", "O"]], [1, 1]), "Hit")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "X"], [ "-", "O"], [ "-", "O"]], [1, 1]), "Found")`)
 }})
 ```
 
-`strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "X", "O", "X"], [ "-", "-", "-"]], [1, 2])` should return `"Hit"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "X", "O", "X"], [ "-", "-", "-"]], [1, 2])` should return `"Found"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "X", "O", "X"], [ "-", "-", "-"]], [1, 2]), "Hit")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "X", "O", "X"], [ "-", "-", "-"]], [1, 2]), "Found")`)
 }})
 ```
 
-`strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [2, 0])` should return `"Sunk"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [2, 0])` should return `"Recovered"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [2, 0]), "Sunk")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [2, 0]), "Recovered")`)
 }})
 ```
 
-`strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [1, 2])` should return `"Miss"`.
+`dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [1, 2])` should return `"Empty"`.
 
 ```js
 ({test: () => { runPython(`
 from unittest import TestCase
-TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [1, 2]), "Miss")`)
+TestCase().assertEqual(dive([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "X"]], [1, 2]), "Empty")`)
 }})
 ```
 
@@ -92,27 +92,27 @@ TestCase().assertEqual(strike([[ "-", "-", "-"], [ "-", "-", "-"], [ "O", "X", "
 ## --seed-contents--
 
 ```py
-def strike(map, coordinates):
+def dive(map, coordinates):
 
     return map
 ```
 
 # --solutions--
 
 ```py
-def strike(map, coordinates):
+def dive(map, coordinates):
     row, col = coordinates
     target = map[row][col]
 
     if target == "-":
-        return "Miss"
+        return "Empty"
 
     if target == "O":
         for r in range(len(map)):
             for c in range(len(map[r])):
                 if (r != row or c != col) and map[r][c] == "O":
-                    return "Hit"
-        return "Sunk"
+                    return "Found"
+        return "Recovered"
 
-    return "Hit"
+    return "Found"
 ```
